title: 106_s121
content: The "Civil Rights Procedures Protection Act of 1999" amends Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to establish exclusive powers and procedures for rights and claims under this title, unless the claimant chooses arbitration or another procedure. It also amends the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to include a new section 16, which establishes exclusive powers and procedures for rights and claims under the Act unless the claimant chooses arbitration or another procedure. SEC. 4 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and SEC. 5 of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 amend the powers and procedures for rights and claims under the respective acts, making them exclusive unless the claimant opts for arbitration or another procedure. The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 is amended to make powers and procedures for rights and claims exclusive, unless the claimant chooses arbitration or another procedure. SEC. 6 amends Section 1977 of the Revised Statutes to make powers and procedures for contract of employment claims exclusive, unless the claimant opts for arbitration or another procedure. SEC. 7 amends the Equal Pay Requirement under the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938. Section 6(d) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to establish exclusive powers and procedures for rights or claims arising under this subsection, unless the claimant chooses arbitration or another procedure. Additionally, the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 is amended by redesignating a section and adding a new section. SEC. 405 of the Act establishes exclusive powers and procedures for rights or claims, unless the claimant opts for arbitration or another procedure. This section also amends Title 9 of the United States Code. SEC. 9 amends Title 9, United States Code by excluding claims of unlawful discrimination in employment based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. SEC. 10 states that these amendments apply to claims arising before the enactment of this Act.
